definition: see 撕破臉|撕破脸[si1 po4 lian3]
ashamed/embarrassed/not having the face (to meet people)/not daring (out of shame)

sentences.english: Be careful what you say to her. She has a thin skin.
sentences.chinese: 你跟她说话要小心，她脸皮很薄。

sentences.english: This means being an unabashed self promoter.
sentences.chinese: 这意味着你要厚着脸皮的自我推销。

sentences.english: We all know you to be a very bashful man .
sentences.chinese: 我们都知道你是个脸皮薄的人。

sentences.english: If you want to be a good salesman, you must be thick-skinned.
sentences.chinese: 如果你想要成为一个好的推销员，你一定要厚脸皮。

sentences.english: Second, you must not be shy, be thick-skinned, and speak up.
sentences.chinese: 其次，别害羞，脸皮厚一点，大声说出来。

sentences.english: This is shameless, I know, but that’s part of the job. (Laughter.)
sentences.chinese: 我知道这有点厚脸皮，但这是我工作的一部分。

sentences.english: He prefers to brazen in out rather than admit defeat.
sentences.chinese: 他不愿承认失败，却宁愿厚着脸皮干下去。

sentences.english: I am now so thick-skinned that such incidents hardly fuss me at all.
sentences.chinese: 我现在的脸皮厚得很，这样的情形对我已经无所谓了。

sentences.english: He said incident reports were filed but ignored by brass.
sentences.chinese: 他说事件报告已经存档了，但是被那些厚脸皮忽视了。

sentences.english: She prefers to brazen it out rather than admit defeat.
sentences.chinese: 她宁可厚着脸皮赖下去，也不愿承认失败。

sentences.english: The foolhardy Zaarin even had the audacity to strike against the Emperor himself.
sentences.chinese: 有勇无谋的扎林甚至厚脸皮到了反击帝国的地步。

sentences.english: After almost wrecking my car last week-end he had the crust to ask to borrow it again.
sentences.chinese: 上周末几乎撞坏了我的车，他还有脸皮要求再借他。

sentences.english: Beaufort had entered the little house with his usual easy assurance.
sentences.chinese: 鲍富特象平时一样厚着脸皮若无其事地走进那小屋。

sentences.english: This can chase me urgently bad, I am timid and not to love an explanation.
sentences.chinese: 这可把我急坏了，我这个人脸皮薄又不爱解释。

sentences.english: He has the cheek to ask for a rise after a week in his new job.
sentences.chinese: 他上工才一个星期，竟厚着脸皮要加工资。

sentences.english: How call you have the gall to complain about other people's being lazy?
sentences.chinese: 你怎么能厚着脸皮报怨说别人不勤快？

definition: self-respect of old person/face/thick-skinned (i.e. impervious to criticism)/brazen
to have no sense of shame/shameless
to blush/to redden (with shame, indignation etc)
to have no sense of shame
to give a hollow laugh/to force a smile/forced laugh/CL:聲|声[sheng1]
